in the graveyard the wind ha got up friend and it is begin to get dark hadn t we better take ourselv off befor it get worse? the wind wa frolick among the yellow leav of the old birch tree and a shower of thick drop fell upon u from the leav one of our parti slip on the clayey soil and clutch at a big grey cross to save himself from fall yegor gryaznorukov titular councillor and cavali he read i knew that gentleman he wa fond of hi wife he wore the stanislav ribbon and read noth hi digest work well life wa all right wasn t it? one would have thought he had no reason to die but ala fate had it eye on him the poor fellow fell a victim to hi habit of observ on one occas when he wa listen at a keyhol he got such a bang on the head from the door that he sustain concuss of the brain (he had a brain) and die and here under thi tombston lie a man who from hi cradl detest vers and epigram a though to mock him hi whole tombston is adorn with vers there is someon come a man in a shabbi overcoat with a shaven bluish crimson counten overtook u he had a bottl under hi arm and a parcel of sausag wa stick out of hi pocket where is the grave of mushkin the actor? he ask u in a huski voic we conduct him toward the grave of mushkin the actor who had die two year befor you are a govern clerk i suppose? we ask him no an actor nowaday it is difficult to distinguish actor from clerk of the consistori no doubt you have notic that that s typic but it s not veri flatter for the govern clerk it wa with difficulti that we found the actor s grave it had sunken wa overgrown with weed and had lost all appear of a grave a cheap littl cross that had begun to rot and wa cover with green moss blacken by the frost had an air of age deject and look a it were ail forgotten friend mushkin we read time had era the never and correct the falsehood of man a subscript for a monument to him wa got up among actor and journalist but they drank up the money the dear fellow sigh the actor bow down to the ground and touch the wet earth with hi knee and hi cap how do you mean drank it? that s veri simpl they collect the money publish a paragraph about it in the newspap and spent it on drink i don t say it to blame them i hope it did them good dear thing good health to them and etern memori to him drink mean bad health and etern memori noth but sad god give u remembr for a time but etern memory—what next you are right there mushkin wa a well known man you see there were a dozen wreath on the coffin and he is alreadi forgotten those to whom he wa dear have forgotten him but those to whom he did harm rememb him i for instanc shall never never forget him for i got noth but harm from him i have no love for the deceas what harm did he do you? great harm sigh the actor and an express of bitter resent overspread hi face to me he wa a villain and a scoundrel—th kingdom of heaven be hi it wa through look at him and listen to him that i becam an actor by hi art he lure me from the parent home he entic me with the excit of an actor s life promis me all sort of things—and brought tear and sorrow an actor s lot is a bitter one i have lost youth sobrieti and the divin semblanc i haven t a half penni to bless myself with my shoe are down at heel my breech are fray and patch and my face look a if it had been gnaw by dog my head s full of freethink and nonsens he rob me of my faith—mi evil geniu it would have been someth if i had had talent but a it is i am ruin for noth it s cold honour friend won t you have some? there is enough for all b r r r let u drink to the rest of hi soul though i don t like him and though he s dead he wa the onli one i had in the world the onli one it s the last time i shall visit him the doctor say i shall soon die of drink so here i have come to say good bye one must forgiv one s enemi we left the actor to convers with the dead mushkin and went on it began drizzl a fine cold rain at the turn into the princip avenu strewn with gravel we met a funer process four bearer wear white calico sash and muddi high boot with leav stick on them carri the brown coffin it wa get dark and they hasten stumbl and shake their burden we ve onli been walk here for a coupl of hour and that is the third brought in alreadi shall we go home friends?
